text: Belizean municipal elections, 1993-1994 was a series of municipal elections held in Belize within a period of twelve months and sandwiching a General election. ==Results== * 1993: Belize City council election (March 18): Then ruling People’s United Party (PUP) won all nine seats and their second straight election. This Election result cannoned with events in Guatemala emboldened the PUP to call a General election on June 1, 1993, which they lost to the United Democratic Party (UDP)/National Alliance for Belizean Rights (NABR) Coalition. * 1994: National town board elections (March): The now ruling United Democratic Party won the majority of seats nationwide in their greatest municipal victory to date, although would loss the Belize City Council. This performance was eventually beaten in the 2006 Belizean municipal elections. Category:Elections in Belize Category:1994 elections
title: 1993–94 Belizean municipal elections
